tit.cmt: 「Katsuranomiya Imperial Prince Misahito」 → 『Imperial Prince Katsura-no-miya Misahito』に、他の親王名と統一させるため、変更しました。

sen.j: 桂宮節仁親王（かつらのみや みさひとしんのう、天保4年11月1日 (旧暦)（1833年12月11日） - 天保7年3月5日 (旧暦)（1836年4月20日））は江戸時代後期の日本の皇族。
sen.e: Katsuranomiya Imperial Prince Misahito (December 11, 1833 – April 20, 1836) was a member of the Japanese imperial family in the late Edo period.
Imperial Prince Katsura-no-miya Misahito (December 11, 1833 – April 20, 1836) was a member of the Japanese Imperial family who lived in the late Edo period.
sen.cmt: 下記のとおり変更、修正しました。・「Katsuranomiya Imperial Prince Misahito」 ⇒ 『Imperial Prince Katsura-no-miya Misahito』・「in the late Edo period」 ⇒ 『who lived in the late Edo period』
sen.e: Imperial Prince Katsura-no-miya Misahito (December 11, 1833 – April 20, 1836) was a member of the Japanese Imperial family who lived in the late Edo period.
He was the 11th successor of the Katsura no miya.
He was the 11th family head of the Katsura-no-miya family.
sen.cmt: ・「the 11th successor」 → 『the 11th family head』に、他の親王表記と統一させるために変更しました。・「the Katsura no miya」 → 『the Katsura-no-miya family』に、変更しました。
sen.e: He was the 11th family head of the Katsura-no-miya family.
He was the 6th son of the Emperor Ninko.
He was the 6th son of the Emperor Ninko.
He was the 6th son of the Emperor Ninko.

sen.j: 母は新待賢門院正親町雅子。
sen.e: His mother was Shintaikenmonin Naoko OGIMACHI.
His mother was Shintaikenmonin Naoko OGIMACHI.
His mother was Shintaikenmonin Naoko OGIMACHI.

sen.j: 幼称は幹宮（もとのみや）。
sen.e: His childhood name was Motonomiya.
His childhood name was Motonomiya.
His childhood name was Motonomiya.

sen.j: 天保6年（1835年）父帝仁孝天皇の命で桂宮を継承する。
sen.e: In 1835, the prince became the head of the Katsura no miya under the order of his father, the Emperor Ninko.
In 1835, the prince became the head of the Katsura-no-miya family under the order of his father, the Emperor Ninko.
sen.cmt: 「Katsura no miya」 ⇒ 『Katsura-no-miya family』に修正しました。
sen.e: In 1835, the prince became the head of the Katsura-no-miya family under the order of his father, the Emperor Ninko.

sen.j: 天保7年（1836年）3月4日親王宣下を受け、節仁と命名されるが、翌日（実は同日）薨去。
sen.e: Although officially invested as an imperial prince and renamed as Misahito on March 4, 1836, he passed away the next day (in fact it was on the same day).
sen.cmt: （実は同日）の部分、事情が分からないため、直訳にしました。
sen.e: On April 19, 1836, he was given the title of Imperial Prince and renamed Misahito; however, he passed away on the following day.
sen.cmt: 以下のように修正＆変更しました。・「on March 4, 1836」 → 『On April 19, 1836』に、修正しました。 （理由→原文を参照すると、'March 4（=3月4日）'とは天保での月日で、西暦1836年では4月19日（=April 19）となります。）・「officially invested as an imperial prince」 → 『he was given the title of Imperial Prince』 （他の親王の表記と統一するために変更しました。）・「and renamed as Misahito」 → 『and renamed Misahito』 （必要がないので、asを削除しました。） ・「the next day」 → 『on the following day』・「(in fact it was on the same day)」 → 『翌日』と記載があり、『（実は同日）』は意味が不明なので、削除しました。
sen.e: On April 19, 1836, he was given the title of Imperial Prince and renamed Misahito; however, he passed away on the following day.
He was at the age of four.
He was at the age of four.
He was at the age of four.
His posthumous Buddhist name is Nyoihouin.
sen.cmt: 如意宝院の読みが不明です。
sen.e: His posthumous Buddhist name is Nyoihouin.
His posthumous Buddhist name is Nyoihouin.
